name: reconsolidate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to become, or cause something to become, stronger and more certain again: He aims to reconsolidate the core party vote behind his team. The troops are disengaging from these areas and re-consolidating around more defensible borders.
More examplesFewer examplesProtests have become increasingly rare as he has reconsolidated power during his presidency.The party is re-consolidating their support base.The company needed to have a more solid and singular vision for a while, until it could reconsolidate.
